channel.title: Java on surface pro 3
channel.description:
well i recently went out and bought me one of these things and i thought it'd be nice for mobile development but any java application ran on the surface is extremely small.
I've tried lowering my resolution drastically but it only affects the OS elements, not the jar itself.
this appends to any web applet / downloaded applet. its extremely small and super funny/frustrating
any ideas/methods to fix?

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Yeah that seems to be everyone’s main concern with the pen. It doesn’t really bother me because I hardly use the pen, but it would still be nice to change what it does.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i personally wish you could change the function of the pen’s button to any type of hotkey, or register it to any app. or even toggle it. i hate working on something and accidentally hitting it/tapping it and one note opening up.

yeah, its just a swipe from the left to the right to go back, but it can still be annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

The only one I really ever used was fresh paint. I tried looking for more in the store but there really is nothing worth while. I used the pen the first couple weeks I got it but it’s been clipped to my keyboard since. If there were more apps that really utilized it, I’d use it a ton more.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

yeah its really nice / fun. do you have any drawing apps you recommend? i dont really like drawing in one note, and fresh paint isn’t the best.

and I’m not in school, i just bought it lol

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I got the 128gb/i5, because I only use it for college etc. Drawing is really nice with the surface pen.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i got the i7 256g

and currently only using it to draw/as a laptop. but the java issue is really frustrating me so I’m mainly on developing on my mac tbh

I’ve yet to find any windows apps that appeal to me, so I haven’t really used the whole ‘tablet’ portion lol

Read full topic

item.title: Java on surface pro 3
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

How do you like your SP3? How long have you owned it, and what CPU/SSD did you get?

item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i haven’t found any solutions online so i was hoping some of the computer nerds over here could help xD

Read full topic
